html:
lamb to the ruler. As a tribute, and following the formalities of the period, the Moabite refugees sent a lamb to the ruler in Judah. This recalls 2 Kgs. 3:4, which describes Mesha, king of Moab, giving a tribute to the king of Judah of one hundred thousand lambs and one hundred thousand rams with their wool.

Sela. Sela may refer to cliffs and caves where the refugees of Moab fled for safety; to Petra, the capital of Edom; or to an unidentified site in Moab.

mount of the daughter of Zion. This is a possible reference to the temple mount in Jerusalem, which is called the daughter of Zion.
